intro: Serratula elegans, commonly known as the elegant serrated cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its basal rosette of silver-green, hairy leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies. Serratula elegans thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Its distinctive appearance and ecological adaptations make it a notable species in its native range.
